subject: What option
description_text:
Hello, 

Can you help me choose what pedals are right for me?

I currently have fanatec v3’s and race on pc. I want new pedals. I only race f1 and LMP style. 

Should i go with the Pro x ultimate or Plus x ? I want to add the haptic motors. 


Stef

conversations.body_text: Hi stef willems,  These are our two newest pedals, the Pro X Ultra has an adjustable hydraulic lever for the more seasoned pro rider. It has lights that give feedback based on game telemetry data, and a much nicer light and shape. If you don't need these features, the Plus X pedals will be better value for money as they have the same elastomers and hydraulics. Both pedals are suitable for F1 and LMP, and are compatible with our haptic system. The specific choice depends on your preferences.

Hello,

Electronic wise they are the same? Also fully compatible with the haptic systeem.

Do you have a discount code for AliExpress? I can pay there using dutch ideal. You have some different coupons running on youre main website now.

Stef
________________________________

Hi stef willems,    The Pro X Ultra has a higher configuration of electronic components, making its signal input and output more accurate. They are all fully compatible with Haptics. Additionally, we do not have a discount code for AliExpress, but you can place an order on our official website and use this 10% discount code: SSN10  https://www.simsonn.com/products/simsonn-racing-sim-pedal-pro-x-ultra

2. When using simhub the VAM Pro’s a lot of times vibrate 2/3 times instead of 1 sometimes they keep vibrating constantly. Do i have to calibrate anything in the simsonn manager first?

Hi stef willems,  Yes, the throttle only requires one screw for fixation. For the brake’s VAM Pro, we recommend using nylon screws and washers to eliminate interference with the brake signal. You may also consider connecting a wire between the control box and a metal screw on the pedal to further reduce interference. In addition, I can also provide you with a step-by-step solution specifically for interference issues related to the Fanatec CLS DD base.      To address EMI (Electromagnetic Interference) issues, please follow the steps below to improve device stability and USB connection reliability:     1.    Ensure proper grounding: Make sure the computer is connected to a three-prong outlet with a reliable ground. Two-prong plugs do not provide grounding.     2.    Control box grounding: Use a green shielding wire to connect the metal housing (such as a copper post or screw) of the control box to any metal screw on the pedal. Ensure the contact point is paint-free and conductive.     3.    Base grounding (e.g., Fanatec / MOZA): It’s recommended to connect the metal part of the base to the PC chassis or an external ground to discharge static buildup.     4.    Avoid high-interference zones: Keep USB cables away from high-voltage power lines or adapters; route cables separately where possible.     5.    Use direct USB connection: Connect devices directly to a rear USB 3.0 port on the PC instead of using unpowered or low-quality USB hubs.     6.    Use USB cables with ferrite cores: If needed, switch to high-quality USB cables with ferrite beads to reduce high-frequency interference.     7.    Keep software and firmware updated: Ensure SIMSONN Manager and firmware are updated to the latest version, as some updates include EMI handling improvements.     8.    Use a USB isolator: If the above methods don’t resolve the issue, using a USB isolator is recommended. It physically separates the USB power and data lines, effectively shielding the control device from EMI sources.

Hello,

The pro x ultra box does not have an grounding cabel option i think. Also i don have imei issues. Input is workin creat. But the vam pro vibration motors keep vibrating longer then needed sometimes after the gear shift effect they vibrate until the next shift. Its more software or firmware then imei issue i think? Input on base and pedals looks fine.

I have a fanatec clubsport DD+ all is connected to ground and i see no sigs of interferrence i think the pro x ultra box solved it? But now the vam pro’s


Stef

Hi stef willems,  We will soon release SIMSONN Manager 2.1.1. The current version has some issues during testing where the motor stop command was not received correctly, but this has already been fixed. In addition, if you experience abnormal brake vibration, you can try using nylon screws and washers to isolate the brake VAM Pro motor from the bracket, which will completely eliminate EMI interference with the pedals. When convenient, please send us a screenshot showing the brake VAM Pro strength settings so that we can verify them. Before replacing the screws with nylon ones, you may also download the VKB JoyTester tool from Google to check whether the motor is interfering with the brake signal.

Good to hear!

If i check brake levels and throttle i see no abnormal interferrence just steady lines. Its just the vibration effect contineus longer then needed. Even if i click test sometimes the motor keeps vibrating 5/10 seconds longer.

I will test with the vkb joy tester, also do you have sizes for the nylon screws and washers maybe? M6X16 of M5x16 i think?

I will test first with the new firmware if its availabe. I now use simhub

Hello,

I have tested interfference with the VKB Joy tester and im happy to tell you i have 0 intereffence with wheel or vam Pro’s..

Just the issue that they dont stop vibrating

Hi stef willems, The nylon screws are M4×8mm, and the washers are M4. For testing, press the brake halfway down and then click the VAM Pro test. If the VKB tool shows a straight line, it means the issue has been resolved. Regarding the vibration not stopping in time, if this issue does not occur in SimHub, then it is clear that SIMSONN Manager needs optimization. Please wait for the upcoming 2.1.1 update, which we will release very soon.

Pro x ultra’s for the pedals and plus x for the VAM Pro’s that also fixed it. So i think it is a firmware issue on the pro x ultra’s control box. (Vibrating longer then needed)

Hi stef willems,    The issue of extended vibration duration can be resolved by ensuring the firmware is up to date. Please note that this is a software bug in SIMSONN Manager 2.1.0, not a firmware problem. We will soon release SIMSONN Manager 2.1.1 along with a new firmware version, which will fix this issue.  In addition, this issue generally does not occur when using SimHub 9.9.3.
